translationBlock.key: location, particle%s[%s, players%s]
Yes
Examples
Vital Info
Find a bug in this page? %sEdit this page yourself, then submit a pull request.%s (Note this page is automatically generated from the documentation in the source code.)
Usages
Sorry, there are no examples for this function! :(
None

Spawns particles at the specified location. The players parameter can be one player or an array of players. If none is given, all players within 32 meters will see the particle. The particle parameter can be a particle name or an associative array defining the characteristics of the particle to be spawned. The array requires the particle name under the key "particle".

Team. All rights reserved.
Docs

Possible particle types: SMOKE_NORMAL, ENCHANTMENT_TABLE, REDSTONE, SOUL_FIRE_FLAME, SNOW_SHOVEL, BUBBLE_COLUMN_UP, SPELL_MOB, REVERSE_PORTAL, CAMPFIRE_SIGNAL_SMOKE, BLOCK_DUST, FALLING_HONEY, SPORE_BLOSSOM_AIR, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, SWEEP_ATTACK, WATER_SPLASH, LANDING_LAVA, SLIME, FALLING_LAVA, DRAGON_BREATH, DRIPPING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, CURRENT_DOWN, ELECTRIC_SPARK, DRIPPING_HONEY, LANDING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, ITEM_CRACK, LIGHT, WARPED_SPORE, DUST_COLOR_TRANSITION, FALLING_DUST, SNEEZE, WATER_BUBBLE, WHITE_ASH, GLOW, FLASH, VILLAGER_ANGRY, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, HEART, LANDING_HONEY, END_ROD, FALLING_NECTAR, CRIT_MAGIC, SUSPENDED, WATER_DROP, SPELL, FALLING_WATER, SPELL_INSTANT, LAVA, WAX_ON, VILLAGER_HAPPY, SQUID_INK, CRIT, VIBRATION, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, CLOUD, BUBBLE_POP, COMPOSTER, SCRAPE, NAUTILUS, FALLING_SPORE_BLOSSOM, SMALL_FLAME, EXPLOSION_LARGE, TOWN_AURA, SUSPENDED_DEPTH, CAMPFIRE_COSY_SMOKE, SOUL, NOTE, ASH, SNOWBALL, SPELL_MOB_AMBIENT, DAMAGE_INDICATOR, SMOKE_LARGE, CRIMSON_SPORE, TOTEM, BARRIER, EXPLOSION_NORMAL, FLAME, SPIT, FALLING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, PORTAL, MOB_APPEARANCE, WAX_OFF, DOLPHIN, SPELL_WITCH, DRIP_WATER, GLOW_SQUID_INK, EXPLOSION_HUGE, SNOWFLAKE, WATER_WAKE, UNKNOWN, FIREWORKS_SPARK, DRIP_LAVA, or BLOCK_CRACK. Some particles have more specific keys and/or special behavior, but the common keys for the particle array are "count" (usually the number of particles to be spawned), "speed" (usually the velocity of the particle), "xoffset", "yoffset", and "zoffset" (usually the ranges from center within which the particle may be offset on that axis). BLOCK_DUST, BLOCK_CRACK and FALLING_DUST particles can take a block type name parameter under the key "block" (default: STONE). ITEM_CRACK particles can take an item array or name under the key "item" (default: STONE). REDSTONE particles take an RGB color array (each 0 - 255) or name under the key "color" (default: RED). DUST_COLOR_TRANSITION particles take a "tocolor" in addition "color". VIBRATION particles take a "destination" location array or entity UUID.

Possible particle types: BLOCK_MARKER, SMOKE_NORMAL, ENCHANTMENT_TABLE, REDSTONE, SOUL_FIRE_FLAME, SNOW_SHOVEL, BUBBLE_COLUMN_UP, SPELL_MOB, REVERSE_PORTAL, CAMPFIRE_SIGNAL_SMOKE, BLOCK_DUST, FALLING_HONEY, SPORE_BLOSSOM_AIR, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, SWEEP_ATTACK, WATER_SPLASH, LANDING_LAVA, SLIME, FALLING_LAVA, DRAGON_BREATH, DRIPPING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, CURRENT_DOWN, ELECTRIC_SPARK, DRIPPING_HONEY, LANDING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, ITEM_CRACK, WARPED_SPORE, DUST_COLOR_TRANSITION, FALLING_DUST, SNEEZE, WATER_BUBBLE, WHITE_ASH, GLOW, FLASH, VILLAGER_ANGRY, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, HEART, LANDING_HONEY, END_ROD, FALLING_NECTAR, CRIT_MAGIC, SUSPENDED, WATER_DROP, SPELL, FALLING_WATER, SPELL_INSTANT, LAVA, WAX_ON, VILLAGER_HAPPY, SQUID_INK, CRIT, VIBRATION, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, CLOUD, BUBBLE_POP, COMPOSTER, SCRAPE, NAUTILUS, FALLING_SPORE_BLOSSOM, SMALL_FLAME, EXPLOSION_LARGE, TOWN_AURA, SUSPENDED_DEPTH, CAMPFIRE_COSY_SMOKE, SOUL, NOTE, ASH, SNOWBALL, SPELL_MOB_AMBIENT, DAMAGE_INDICATOR, SMOKE_LARGE, CRIMSON_SPORE, TOTEM, EXPLOSION_NORMAL, FLAME, SPIT, FALLING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, PORTAL, MOB_APPEARANCE, WAX_OFF, DOLPHIN, SPELL_WITCH, DRIP_WATER, GLOW_SQUID_INK, EXPLOSION_HUGE, SNOWFLAKE, WATER_WAKE, FIREWORKS_SPARK, DRIP_LAVA, or BLOCK_CRACK. BUBBLE_POP, COMPOSTER, NAUTILUS, SHRIEK, FALLING_SPORE_BLOSSOM, SMALL_FLAME, EXPLOSION_LARGE, TOWN_AURA, ASH, DAMAGE_INDICATOR, TOTEM, SPIT, FALLING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, PORTAL, EGG_CRACK, WAX_OFF, ITEM_COBWEB, SPELL_WITCH, GLOW_SQUID_INK, EXPLOSION_HUGE, SNOWFLAKE, WATER_WAKE, FIREWORKS_SPARK, DRIP_LAVA, GUST_EMITTER_SMALL, BLOCK_CRACK, BLOCK_MARKER, PALE_OAK_LEAVES, ENCHANTMENT_TABLE, REDSTONE, SNOW_SHOVEL, SPELL_MOB, FALLING_HONEY, SPORE_BLOSSOM_AIR, DRAGON_BREATH, DRIPPING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, CURRENT_DOWN, TRIAL_SPAWNER_DETECTION_OMINOUS, ELECTRIC_SPARK, LANDING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, INFESTED, GUST_EMITTER_LARGE, CHERRY_LEAVES, SNEEZE, WHITE_ASH, GLOW, OMINOUS_SPAWNING, SCULK_CHARGE_POP, LANDING_HONEY, TRIAL_SPAWNER_DETECTION, RAID_OMEN, CRIT_MAGIC, SUSPENDED, WATER_DROP, SPELL, FALLING_WATER, LAVA, WAX_ON, CRIT, CLOUD, SCRAPE, SMALL_GUST, SUSPENDED_DEPTH, CAMPFIRE_COSY_SMOKE, SOUL, NOTE, SNOWBALL, SMOKE_LARGE, SONIC_BOOM, CRIMSON_SPORE, EXPLOSION_NORMAL, FLAME, GUST, MOB_APPEARANCE, DOLPHIN, DRIP_WATER, or SCULK_CHARGE. %sSome particles have more specific keys and/or special behavior, but the common keys for the particle array are "count" (usually the number of particles to be spawned), "speed" (usually the velocity of the particle), "xoffset", "yoffset", and "zoffset" (usually the ranges from center within which the particle may be offset on that axis). %sBLOCK_DUST, BLOCK_CRACK, BLOCK_CRUMBLE, BLOCK_MARKER, DUST_PILLAR, and FALLING_DUST particles can take a block type name parameter under the key "block" (default: STONE). %sITEM_CRACK particles can take an item array or name under the key "item" (default: STONE). %sREDSTONE and SPELL_MOB particles take an RGB color array (each 0 - 255) or name under the key "color" (defaults to RED for REDSTONE, WHITE for SPELL_MOB). %sDUST_COLOR_TRANSITION particles take a "tocolor" in addition "color". %sVIBRATION particles take a "destination" location array or entity UUID. %sSCULK_CHARGE particles take an "angle" in radians. (defaults to 0.0) %sSHRIEK particles take an integer "delay" in ticks before playing. (defaults to 0) %sTRAIL particles take a "target" location array, a "color", and a "duration" integer in ticks.

Possible particle types: SMOKE_NORMAL, SOUL_FIRE_FLAME, DUST_PILLAR, BUBBLE_COLUMN_UP, DUST_PLUME, REVERSE_PORTAL, CAMPFIRE_SIGNAL_SMOKE, TRIAL_OMEN, BLOCK_DUST, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, SWEEP_ATTACK, WATER_SPLASH, LANDING_LAVA, SLIME, FALLING_LAVA, TRAIL, DRIPPING_HONEY, ITEM_CRACK, WARPED_SPORE, DUST_COLOR_TRANSITION, FALLING_DUST, WATER_BUBBLE, FLASH, VILLAGER_ANGRY, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, BLOCK_CRUMBLE, HEART, END_ROD, FALLING_NECTAR, VAULT_CONNECTION, SCULK_SOUL, WHITE_SMOKE, SPELL_INSTANT, VILLAGER_HAPPY, SQUID_INK, VIBRATION, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, BUBBLE_POP, COMPOSTER, NAUTILUS, SHRIEK, FALLING_SPORE_BLOSSOM, SMALL_FLAME, EXPLOSION_LARGE, TOWN_AURA, ASH, DAMAGE_INDICATOR, TOTEM, SPIT, FALLING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, PORTAL, EGG_CRACK, WAX_OFF, ITEM_COBWEB, SPELL_WITCH, GLOW_SQUID_INK, EXPLOSION_HUGE, SNOWFLAKE, WATER_WAKE, FIREWORKS_SPARK, DRIP_LAVA, GUST_EMITTER_SMALL, BLOCK_CRACK, BLOCK_MARKER, PALE_OAK_LEAVES, ENCHANTMENT_TABLE, REDSTONE, SNOW_SHOVEL, SPELL_MOB, FALLING_HONEY, SPORE_BLOSSOM_AIR, DRAGON_BREATH, DRIPPING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, CURRENT_DOWN, TRIAL_SPAWNER_DETECTION_OMINOUS, ELECTRIC_SPARK, LANDING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, INFESTED, GUST_EMITTER_LARGE, CHERRY_LEAVES, SNEEZE, WHITE_ASH, GLOW, OMINOUS_SPAWNING, SCULK_CHARGE_POP, LANDING_HONEY, TRIAL_SPAWNER_DETECTION, RAID_OMEN, CRIT_MAGIC, SUSPENDED, WATER_DROP, SPELL, FALLING_WATER, LAVA, WAX_ON, CRIT, CLOUD, SCRAPE, SMALL_GUST, SUSPENDED_DEPTH, CAMPFIRE_COSY_SMOKE, SOUL, NOTE, SNOWBALL, SMOKE_LARGE, SONIC_BOOM, CRIMSON_SPORE, EXPLOSION_NORMAL, FLAME, GUST, MOB_APPEARANCE, DOLPHIN, DRIP_WATER, or SCULK_CHARGE.%sSome particles have more specific keys and/or special behavior, but the common keys for the particle array are:%s'''count''' : (int) Usually the number of particles to be spawned. A value of 0 (default) can create different particle data behavior than larger numbers.%s'''speed''' : (double) Usually the velocity of the particle. Can be other things (size for EXPLOSION_LARGE) depending on other values, like the particle type and count.%s'''xoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset width on the x-axis. An offset can also be other things (velocity vector's x component for SMOKE_NORMAL) depending on other values, like the particle type and count.%s'''yoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset width on the y-axis.%s'''zoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset width on the z-axis.%s'''force''' : (boolean) Extends visibility range from 32 to 512 meters and encourages clients to render it despite client settings.%sBLOCK_DUST, BLOCK_CRACK, BLOCK_CRUMBLE, BLOCK_MARKER, DUST_PILLAR, and FALLING_DUST particles can take a block type name parameter under the key "block" (default: STONE).%sITEM_CRACK particles can take an item array or name under the key "item" (default: STONE).%sREDSTONE and SPELL_MOB particles take an RGB color array (each 0 - 255) or name under the key "color" (defaults to RED for REDSTONE, WHITE for SPELL_MOB).%sDUST_COLOR_TRANSITION particles take a "tocolor" in addition "color".%sVIBRATION particles take a "destination" location array or entity UUID.%sSCULK_CHARGE particles take an "angle" in radians. (defaults to 0.0)%sSHRIEK particles take an integer "delay" in ticks before playing. (defaults to 0)%sTRAIL particles take a "target" location array, a "color" as an RGB array or name, and a "duration" integer in ticks.

Possible particle types: SMOKE_NORMAL, SOUL_FIRE_FLAME, DUST_PILLAR, BUBBLE_COLUMN_UP, DUST_PLUME, REVERSE_PORTAL, CAMPFIRE_SIGNAL_SMOKE, TRIAL_OMEN, BLOCK_DUST, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, SWEEP_ATTACK, WATER_SPLASH, LANDING_LAVA, TINTED_LEAVES, SLIME, FALLING_LAVA, TRAIL, DRIPPING_HONEY, ITEM_CRACK, WARPED_SPORE, DUST_COLOR_TRANSITION, FALLING_DUST, WATER_BUBBLE, FLASH, VILLAGER_ANGRY, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, BLOCK_CRUMBLE, HEART, END_ROD, FALLING_NECTAR, VAULT_CONNECTION, SCULK_SOUL, WHITE_SMOKE, SPELL_INSTANT, VILLAGER_HAPPY, SQUID_INK, VIBRATION, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, BUBBLE_POP, COMPOSTER, NAUTILUS, SHRIEK, FALLING_SPORE_BLOSSOM, SMALL_FLAME, EXPLOSION_LARGE, TOWN_AURA, ASH, DAMAGE_INDICATOR, TOTEM, SPIT, FALLING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, PORTAL, EGG_CRACK, WAX_OFF, ITEM_COBWEB, FIREFLY, SPELL_WITCH, GLOW_SQUID_INK, EXPLOSION_HUGE, SNOWFLAKE, WATER_WAKE, FIREWORKS_SPARK, DRIP_LAVA, GUST_EMITTER_SMALL, BLOCK_CRACK, BLOCK_MARKER, PALE_OAK_LEAVES, ENCHANTMENT_TABLE, REDSTONE, SNOW_SHOVEL, SPELL_MOB, FALLING_HONEY, SPORE_BLOSSOM_AIR, DRAGON_BREATH, DRIPPING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, CURRENT_DOWN, TRIAL_SPAWNER_DETECTION_OMINOUS, ELECTRIC_SPARK, LANDING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, INFESTED, GUST_EMITTER_LARGE, CHERRY_LEAVES, SNEEZE, WHITE_ASH, GLOW, OMINOUS_SPAWNING, SCULK_CHARGE_POP, LANDING_HONEY, TRIAL_SPAWNER_DETECTION, RAID_OMEN, CRIT_MAGIC, SUSPENDED, WATER_DROP, SPELL, FALLING_WATER, LAVA, WAX_ON, CRIT, CLOUD, SCRAPE, SMALL_GUST, SUSPENDED_DEPTH, CAMPFIRE_COSY_SMOKE, SOUL, NOTE, SNOWBALL, SMOKE_LARGE, SONIC_BOOM, CRIMSON_SPORE, EXPLOSION_NORMAL, FLAME, GUST, MOB_APPEARANCE, DOLPHIN, DRIP_WATER, or SCULK_CHARGE.%sSome particles have more specific keys and/or special behavior, but the common keys for the particle array are:%s'''count''' : (int) Usually the number of particles to be spawned. A value of 0 (default) can create different particle data behavior than larger numbers.%s'''speed''' : (double) Usually the velocity of the particle. Can be other things (size for EXPLOSION_LARGE with count 0) depending on other values, like the particle type and count.%s'''xoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset on the x-axis. An offset can also be other things (velocity vector's x component for SMOKE_NORMAL) depending on other values, like the particle type and count.%s'''yoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset on the y-axis.%s'''zoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset on the z-axis.%s'''force''' : (boolean) Extends visibility range from 32 to 512 meters and encourages clients to render it despite client settings.%sBLOCK_DUST, BLOCK_CRACK, BLOCK_CRUMBLE, BLOCK_MARKER, DUST_PILLAR, and FALLING_DUST particles can take a block type name parameter under the key "block" (default: STONE).%sITEM_CRACK particles can take an item array or name under the key "item" (default: STONE).%sREDSTONE and SPELL_MOB particles take an RGB color array (each 0 - 255) or name under the key "color" (defaults to RED for REDSTONE, WHITE for SPELL_MOB).%sDUST_COLOR_TRANSITION particles take a "tocolor" in addition "color".%sVIBRATION particles take a "destination" location array or entity UUID.%sSCULK_CHARGE particles take an "angle" in radians. (defaults to 0.0)%sSHRIEK particles take an integer "delay" in ticks before playing. (defaults to 0)%sTRAIL particles take a "target" location array, a "color" as an RGB array or name, and a "duration" integer in ticks.

Possible particle types: SMOKE_NORMAL, SOUL_FIRE_FLAME, DUST_PILLAR, BUBBLE_COLUMN_UP, DUST_PLUME, REVERSE_PORTAL, CAMPFIRE_SIGNAL_SMOKE, TRIAL_OMEN, BLOCK_DUST, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, SWEEP_ATTACK, WATER_SPLASH, LANDING_LAVA, TINTED_LEAVES, SLIME, FALLING_LAVA, TRAIL, DRIPPING_HONEY, ITEM_CRACK, WARPED_SPORE, DUST_COLOR_TRANSITION, FALLING_DUST, WATER_BUBBLE, FLASH, VILLAGER_ANGRY, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_LAVA, FALLING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, BLOCK_CRUMBLE, HEART, END_ROD, FALLING_NECTAR, VAULT_CONNECTION, SCULK_SOUL, WHITE_SMOKE, SPELL_INSTANT, VILLAGER_HAPPY, SQUID_INK, VIBRATION, DRIPPING_DRIPSTONE_WATER, BUBBLE_POP, COMPOSTER, NAUTILUS, SHRIEK, FALLING_SPORE_BLOSSOM, SMALL_FLAME, EXPLOSION_LARGE, TOWN_AURA, ASH, DAMAGE_INDICATOR, TOTEM, SPIT, FALLING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, PORTAL, EGG_CRACK, WAX_OFF, ITEM_COBWEB, FIREFLY, SPELL_WITCH, GLOW_SQUID_INK, EXPLOSION_HUGE, SNOWFLAKE, WATER_WAKE, FIREWORKS_SPARK, DRIP_LAVA, GUST_EMITTER_SMALL, BLOCK_CRACK, BLOCK_MARKER, PALE_OAK_LEAVES, ENCHANTMENT_TABLE, REDSTONE, SNOW_SHOVEL, SPELL_MOB, FALLING_HONEY, SPORE_BLOSSOM_AIR, DRAGON_BREATH, DRIPPING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, CURRENT_DOWN, TRIAL_SPAWNER_DETECTION_OMINOUS, ELECTRIC_SPARK, LANDING_OBSIDIAN_TEAR, INFESTED, GUST_EMITTER_LARGE, CHERRY_LEAVES, SNEEZE, WHITE_ASH, GLOW, OMINOUS_SPAWNING, SCULK_CHARGE_POP, LANDING_HONEY, TRIAL_SPAWNER_DETECTION, RAID_OMEN, CRIT_MAGIC, SUSPENDED, WATER_DROP, SPELL, FALLING_WATER, LAVA, WAX_ON, CRIT, CLOUD, SCRAPE, SMALL_GUST, SUSPENDED_DEPTH, CAMPFIRE_COSY_SMOKE, SOUL, NOTE, SNOWBALL, SMOKE_LARGE, COPPER_FIRE_FLAME, SONIC_BOOM, CRIMSON_SPORE, EXPLOSION_NORMAL, FLAME, GUST, MOB_APPEARANCE, DOLPHIN, DRIP_WATER, or SCULK_CHARGE.%sSome particles have more specific keys and/or special behavior, but the common keys for the particle array are:%s'''count''' : (int) Usually the number of particles to be spawned. A value of 0 (default) can create different particle data behavior than larger numbers.%s'''speed''' : (double) Usually the velocity of the particle. Can be other things (size for EXPLOSION_LARGE with count 0) depending on other values, like the particle type and count.%s'''xoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset on the x-axis. An offset can also be other things (velocity vector's x component for SMOKE_NORMAL) depending on other values, like the particle type and count.%s'''yoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset on the y-axis.%s'''zoffset''' : (double) Usually the random offset on the z-axis.%s'''force''' : (boolean) Extends visibility range from 32 to 512 meters and encourages clients to render it despite client settings.%sBLOCK_DUST, BLOCK_CRACK, BLOCK_CRUMBLE, BLOCK_MARKER, DUST_PILLAR, and FALLING_DUST particles can take a block type name parameter under the key "block" (default: STONE).%sITEM_CRACK particles can take an item array or name under the key "item" (default: STONE).%sREDSTONE, SPELL, and SPELL_INSTANT particles take an RGB color array (each 0 - 255) or name under the key "color" (defaults to RED for REDSTONE, WHITE for others).%sSPELL_MOB and FLASH particles take an ARGB color array (each 0 - 255) or name under the key "color" (defaults to opaque WHITE).%sSPELL, SPELL_INSTANT and DRAGON_BREATH particles take a "power" value that scales velocity. (defaults to 1.0)%sDUST_COLOR_TRANSITION particles take a "tocolor" in addition "color".%sVIBRATION particles take a "destination" location array or entity UUID.%sSCULK_CHARGE particles take an "angle" in radians. (defaults to 0.0)%sSHRIEK particles take an integer "delay" in ticks before playing. (defaults to 0)%sTRAIL particles take a "target" location array, a "color" as an RGB array or name, and a "duration" integer in ticks.
